titleStmt.title: Dǝrsanä Madḫāne ʿĀlam “Homily on the Saviour of the World” / Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä Madḫāne ʿĀlam “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” / Malkǝʿā Madḫāne ʿĀlam “Image of the Saviour of the World”

msContents.summary:
I) Dǝrsanä mädḫane ʿaläm “Homily on the Saviour of the World” (fols. 3ra-13ra l.7) II) Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä mädḫane ʿaläm “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” (fols. 13ra l.8-72ra l.11): II-1) Introduction (fols. 13ra l.8-15ra l.5) II-2) Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” (fols. 15ra l.7-72ra l.3) II-3) About the devotion of Täklä Maryam to the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (täzkarä Mädḫǝn) (fols. 38rb l.7-41ra l.15) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 194b) II-4) About the reward for those who observe the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (fols. 41ra l.15-42vb) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 197a) II-5) How Täklä Maryam brought many souls from Hell by the order of the Child Jesus who appeared to him (fols. 31ra l.10-32ra l.20) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 198a) II-6) How Christ promised to Täklä Maryam that He would release 500 souls from the hell on the day of the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (fols. 50vb l.14-54ra l.2) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 65b) II-7) Vision of Täklä Maryam about the life of saints in Heaven (fols. 54ra l.2-58rb) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 206b) II-8) Vision of Täklä Maryam concerning the moon that came down from heaven (fols. 58va-61vb) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 59b) II-9) Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabuna Täklä Maryam (fols. 62ra-72ra l.3): II-9.1) How the saint healed a child with a swollen throat (fols. 62ra-62vb l.12) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 192b) II-9.2) How the saint healed a sick child who was near death (fols. 62vb l.13-64rb l.4) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 193a) II-9.3) About light that appeared over the dough from which the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World was made (fols. 64rb l.4-64vb) (cf. EMML 1779, fol. 71b) II-9.4) How ʾabuna Täklä Maryam healed a barren woman (fols.65ra-66ra l.9) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 72b) II-9.5) How pieces of bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World turned into the icon of Virgin Mary with her beloved Child (fols.66ra l.10-66vb l.15) (cf. EMML 4810, fol. 80b; EMML 4817, fol. 65a) II-9.6) About a man who ate the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World after he ate another bread (fols. 66vb l.16-68ra l.8) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 193b) II-9.7) About a ruler who met a recluse in a cave while campaigning against the Agäw (fols. 68ra l.9-72ra l.3) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 76b) II-9.8) Dǝrsanä mädḫane ʿaläm, continuation (fol. 72ra l.4-l.11) III) Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World” (fols.72ra l.14-79vb l.2).
Additio 1.

msItem.note: Text I-2) is an Introduction to the Vita of Takla Māryām (cf.MKL-007, fols. 5r-6rb l.16).

supportDesc.condition: The back board is cracked and repaired with a cord and metal staples. The sewing on the second pair of sewing stations is partly missing. A hole is carefully amended in fol. 43.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: The script tends to square forms.

list.item: f. 79vb: Donation note. f. 79vb: ዘወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መርሀ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፨ በዘመነ፡ ሲመቱ፡ ለተስፋ፡ ሚካካኤል[sic]፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። አሜን፨ f. 79vb: Who who donated it to the church of St. George so that it might be his guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. During the time of Tasfā Mikāʾel’s office. The donor is not mentioned, but it appears that the note refers to the name Walda Śǝllase mentioned in the concluding supplication. Besides, the note mentions Tasfā Mikāʾel, the head of St. George’s church. It is written in a secondary hand, the same which inserted the names of the donors in the supplication formulas.
- Writing exercises, doodles: the front board, 2r, 66r, 67r, 79v, 80v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two rows of small holes are visible on the spine folds of the quires.

decoDesc.decoNote: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; 1st, 2nd, 15th and 16th line in the incipit page of Text I; 1st and 3rd line of the incipit of Text II; one or two initial lines of the sections of Text I; the words ሰላም and ስብሐት in Text II; some words in Text II; elements of punctuation signs; Ethiopic numbers and elements of Ethiopic numbers. The names of the donors are rubricated in vivid crimson.
